title.narrative: Corporate and Public Sector Accountivility Project

description.narrative: The main Project Development Objective is to strengthen accountability and transparency in financial reporting for the public and corporate sectors in line with international best practices. The key beneficiaries are the Public Interest Entities including State-Owned Enterprises, the Chamber of Accounts (the country's supreme audit institution), the Chamber of Auditors (in its role as the country's auditing services regulator and standard-setter, subject to whatever rebalancing of responsibilities between the Ministry of Finance and the Chamber of Auditors may take place as part of the enhancements introduced when improving the statutory framework), the Ministry of Finance, and accounting and auditing professionals and stakeholders in Azerbaijan.

title.narrative: Accountability in management of public funds strengthened through improvements in the external audit and internal controls environments

comment.narrative: % (% of total budget expenditures audited, using new methodology, by Chamber of Accounts + % of state budget processed throughFARABI)

title.narrative: Accounting and auditing profession strengthened through the establishment of training and certification programs and education standards in line with international standards.
Transparency, self-governance and education in the accounting and audit profession improved with the establishment of an Association of Professional Accountants that follows international standards

comment.narrative: The Association will be fully functional by the end of 2013

title.narrative: APAA is capable of preparing new/revised accounting and audit standards when necessary and fully responsible for marking exams written by students under National Accounting Qualification Program

comment.narrative: project activities include training of APAA staff to develop accounting and audit standards and mark exams to be written under NAQ
APAA will recruit staff as soon as financial resources are available

title.narrative: % of items completed in the Strategic Development Plan of the Chamber of Accounts
Charter and other legal documents for the establishment of Association of Professional Accountants of Azerbaijan are prepared and registered with the Ministry of Justice

comment.narrative: Association option should be first decided, then all legal documents will be adopted.
The number of accredited trainers should increase to 35 by June 30, 2015
11 trainers have been accredited by contractor, one of the leading UK accounting and Audit teaching company.

title.narrative: # of Key budget organizations and Line Ministries using unified automatic accounting system.

comment.narrative: 60 additional sites will be added until project closure.
39 pilot sites are completed.

title.narrative: # of NASBOs issued based on IPSAS and explanatory notes

comment.narrative: The target has been met already
All NASBOs have been prepared and issued.

title.narrative: % of total budget expenditures audited, using new methodology, by Chamber of Accounts.

comment.narrative: The new methodology will be used starting from second half of 2014
Contractors are working with the Chamber staff to develop new methodology.

title.narrative: Number of updated IFRS translated, explanatory notes issued

comment.narrative: IFRS 2012 version will be fully translated and adopted by the end of 2013
Currently the MOF 2011 version of IFRS translated

title.narrative: # of accredited training programs (incl. undergraduate, graduate and vocational training programs)

comment.narrative: All three current programs and additional program for tutors will be registered by the end of 2014
There are now 3 programs though none of them officially been registered

title.narrative: # of students successfully passing the various training programs

comment.narrative: The number of Students should reach 3500 by the end of June 2015
Total number of students enrolled is around 1500, including 16 registered for fee based courses

title.narrative: # of new accounting and audit, tax related textbooks introduced at higher education institutes.

comment.narrative: 7 textbooks will be introduced by the end of Feb 2014
all textbooks have been prepared but none of them have been yet approved by the Ministry of Education
